page.title: 04Great Horwood Silver Band
page.content: There are roughly 35 people of both sexes in the band. The age range is between nine and seventy-four years of age. The music they play ranges from pop to classics. They have a uniform which is black trousers or skirt, a red jacket with gold trimmings and a maroon tie with GHB on it. Every Wednesday evening between 7.45 p.m. and 9.30 p.m. they meet in the village hall for practice. The instruments range from cornets, flugel horns and euphoniums to basses,trombones and drums. The band was started in 1888 and it performs concerts and engagements within a fifteen mile radius of the village, although the furthest it has travelled is to Folkestone. A junior band was started 12 years ago and was restarted 2 years ago and has just played its first concert.
